snippet: The university in Austin said most of the missing 100 brains, collected decades ago for research, had been disposed of as biological waste.
abstract: University of Texas at Austin issues statement that most a collection of 100 human brains that had seemingly disappeared from one of its research centers were properly disposed of in 2002, in compliance with rules for biological waste.
lead_paragraph: The university in Austin said most of the missing 100 brains, collected decades ago for research, had been disposed of as biological waste.

headline.main: University of Texas Says It Can Account for Missing Brain Specimens
headline.print_headline: University Says It Can Account for Missing Brains

keywords.value: Malformed: Forgotten Brains of the Texas State Mental Hospital (Book)
